text: ^ I'll put up an issue for this since this is likely to be on the forms team side

In the old design manager, I'm adding custom modules to a design with the Custom HUBL built-in module so I can a label to each custom module.. does that make any sense?! Anyway, is there any reason why the Hubl module's label wouldn't pull through to the page editor?
Yeah, it’s been discussed before with the forms team. Maybe someday!

Unless you manually add unique hubl modules with unique labels in the template to feed through the template, you can’t do it to my knowledge. If you’re using the same custom module multiple times in a page, it’s going to pull through the same repeating label for each, nothing unique. We currently don’t have access/ability to edit the way things are labeled or laid out (for the most part) in the Page Editor slide-out.
{% custom_widget "floating_cta" widget_name='Floating service CTA box', label='Floating CTA service box', no_wrapper='true' %}
So this, added with a Custom Hubl built-in module, wouldn't pull through labeled "Floating CTA service box" on the page editor slide out? -- I swear I've done this before the same way and it worked.
The new Bot/AI piece of HubSpot messaging from the MotionAI acquisition, is that in beta? if so can i  add it to portal 3848995 (they are saying there is beta on this, i might have missed it)

The bit we're struggling with on this is how the relationship between the embedded HS form and the hubdb would work. Would we want every submission on the form to go into the db row straight away and automatically render on the site? That seems like it could have a potential for abuse :thinking_face:
somebody has works doing custom lead flows?
add export_to_template_context=True
then use {{ widget_data.floating_cta.label }}
like, customizing the lead flow by tags on some blogpost… “if -this tag- you see -this lead flow-” ?
not sure thats possible within the lead flow options unless you create your own leadflow using a custom module.
Also, the developer info doesnt have any information about the lead flows so you wouldnt be able to target it through hubl either

So we're having an issue with one of clients monthly blog emails that is sent out. For some reason, its not showing any blogs from the previous year. I have the blog set to show 5 blogs and have it styled appropriately but its only showing the 2 blogs they did in January 2018 and nothing from 2017... anyone else having this issue?
i've also changed the number down to one, then two, but as soon as i go 3 and above (goes into previous year) i dont get anyhting else but 2018 blogs
recreating the email with the "RSS Email" option shows it correctly (minus featured image) but for some reason the main frequency email does not so i dont know what could be the cause

ive tested this on multiple portals and same issue. For those who send on the 1st of the month, this could be a problem as any Jan 1 sends with the monthly blog notification would be emtpy essentially.

So it looks like (and please let me know if this is correct) the monthly bog subscription template is programmed to only pull the previous months blog posts and nothing else. For example, Jan 2018 will pull from Dec 2017 till whatever is the send frequency date in Jan 2018. Also Feb 2018 will only pull Jan 2018 and forward till the send frequency date. Is this correct?

I didn’t find the HubSpot Cookie to change ? Can you help me more <@U38EZFVFE>. Sorry for the inconvenient ! The HubSpot Support doesn’t know how to do this... Do you know which cookie is in charge of language ?
<@U2H3TT8F2> That seems correct.. I know that if it was ever sent at all it will not send either.
You are not editing the Existing Cookie. You woul dhmake your own. Using Local Storage in the browser is the best and easiest way.
yea, our client decided to pause the monthly and instead in Jan do a "our top blogs of 2017" then resume in Feb which means anything published dec 2nd - 31st of 2017 is not on there
we're just doing a normal RSS email to make up for the gap
Ok <@U38EZFVFE>! Thanks I will dig into this direction
You could do a normal blog for loop with recent posts vs the rss couldn't you?
its in an email, which I could do but RSS accomplishes it just as well
less custom coding to be done
